subtopics.title: Chrono-fitness
points: Exercise between 6–10 AM for peak energy and focus
Sleep early and consistently to support your body clock
Warm up longer in the morning to prevent injuries
Choose energizing workouts like walking or yoga
Hydrate after waking and take a light pre-workout snack
Get post-workout sunlight to improve mood and circadian rhythm

subtopics.title: Muscle composition
points: Do aerobic workouts such as running, cycling, or swimming
Perform steady cardio or moderate intervals 4–5 days weekly
Use light weights with high reps for endurance
Fuel workouts with carbs and proper hydration
Add yoga or stretching for muscle balance

subtopics.title: Stress regulation
points: Practice deep breathing or meditation daily
Avoid screens 60 minutes before sleep
Maintain a consistent sleep schedule

subtopics.title: Cognitive resilience
points: Engage in puzzles or learning activities
Maintain social interactions
Get adequate omega-3 intake

subtopics.title: Balanced eating
points: Include protein in every meal
Eat colorful vegetables daily
Limit processed foods and sugars
Stay hydrated throughout the day

subtopics.title: Meal timing
points: Eat breakfast within an hour of waking
Avoid heavy meals before bedtime
Space meals 4-5 hours apart
